# DeKode Camp — Full Site Documentation for AI Systems

> DeKode Camp is a tech education platform specializing in Salesforce and Full Stack development training. The platform helps career changers, aspiring professionals, and students break into the tech industry through structured, hands-on training programs.

---

## Organization Details

- **Name**: DeKode Camp
- **Website**: https://www.dekodecamp.com
- **Type**: Educational Organization / Tech Training Platform
- **Contact**: info@dekodecamp.com
- **Social Media**: Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn (@dekodecamp)
- **Tagline**: "Decode Tech, Unlock Your Future"

---

## Training Programs

### Salesforce Admin (ADM-201)
**URL**: https://www.dekodecamp.com/programs/salesforce-adm201

Comprehensive Salesforce Administrator training program that prepares students for the Salesforce Administrator (ADM-201) certification exam. Covers:
- Salesforce platform fundamentals (navigation, core objects, data model)
- Data management and analytics (reports, dashboards, Data Loader)
- Security and access management (profiles, permission sets, role hierarchy)
- Automation with Flow Builder (record-triggered flows, screen flows)
- Customization and configuration (custom objects, page layouts, Lightning App Builder)
- Integration fundamentals (REST/SOAP APIs, Connected Apps)

### Salesforce Developer
**URL**: https://www.dekodecamp.com/programs/salesforce-developer

Developer training program for building custom Salesforce applications. Covers:
- Apex programming language for server-side logic
- Lightning Web Components (LWC) for modern UI development
- Salesforce API integration patterns
- Einstein Copilot and Agentforce AI tools
- DevOps for Salesforce (CI/CD with Salesforce DX, GitHub Actions)
- Connected Apps and OAuth integration

### Full Stack Developer
**URL**: https://www.dekodecamp.com/programs/full-stack-developer

Full-stack web development program covering modern web technologies. Covers:
- Modern JavaScript (ES6+) and TypeScript
- React and Next.js framework development
- LWC (Lightning Web Components) for Salesforce front-ends
- Building headless Salesforce apps with React/Next.js front-ends
- Database design and API development
- Deployment and hosting

### Career Pathways
**URL**: https://www.dekodecamp.com/programs/career-pathways

Guided career pathway programs that help students choose the right tech career track based on their background, interests, and goals.

### Salesforce Bootcamp
**URL**: https://www.dekodecamp.com/salesforce-bootcamp

Intensive bootcamp-style Salesforce training for students who want an accelerated learning experience.

---

## Blog Content

### Essential Salesforce Admin Skills for 2025
**URL**: https://www.dekodecamp.com/blogs/essential-salesforce-admin-skills-2025
**Published**: January 18, 2026

Comprehensive guide to the 10 essential skills every Salesforce Administrator needs in 2025:

**Technical Skills:**
1. Advanced Flow Builder Mastery (Record-Triggered Flows, Screen Flows, error handling)
2. Data Management & Analytics (reporting, dashboards, Data Loader, deduplication)
3. Security & Access Management (profiles, permission sets, role hierarchy, field-level security)
4. Customization & Configuration (custom objects, page layouts, Lightning App Builder)
5. Integration Fundamentals (REST/SOAP APIs, webhooks, Connected Apps, OAuth)

**Soft Skills:**
6. Business Process Analysis
7. Communication & Training
8. Change Management
9. Problem-Solving & Troubleshooting
10. Continuous Learning & Adaptability

### Salesforce Admin Journey: What to Expect
**URL**: https://www.dekodecamp.com/blogs/salesforce-admin-journey-what-to-expect
**Published**: January 25, 2026

Complete roadmap for becoming a Salesforce Admin in 9-12 months:

- **Phase 1 (Months 1-3)**: Foundation Building — platform navigation, core objects, data model, basic reporting, community engagement
- **Phase 2 (Months 4-8)**: Skill Development — custom objects, page layouts, validation rules, Flow Builder automation, security controls
- **Phase 3 (Months 9-12)**: Certification & Portfolio — ADM-201 exam prep (2-3 months focused study), portfolio with documented projects

Career advancement tracks: Senior Administrator, Salesforce Development, Solution Architect, Consultant.

### Build a Portfolio That Gets You Hired
**URL**: https://www.dekodecamp.com/blogs/build-portfolio-that-gets-you-hired
**Published**: January 22, 2026

Case study of Sarah Martinez, a former teacher who transitioned to Salesforce Admin (earning 40% more) by building a standout portfolio. Key strategies:

- Work on real business scenarios (volunteer with nonprofits)
- Document your process (problem, analysis, solution, results)
- Include visual evidence (screenshots, workflow diagrams, dashboards)
- Quantify impact (e.g., "reduced data entry time by 60%", "improved lead conversion by 25%")
- Use the STAR method for interview presentations
- Leverage transferable soft skills from previous careers

### AI Agents in the Salesforce Ecosystem
**URL**: https://www.dekodecamp.com/blogs/ai-agents-salesforce-ecosystem
**Published**: February 2, 2026

Analysis of how AI agents (Einstein Copilot, Agentforce) are changing Salesforce:

- AI agents differ from traditional automation — they are autonomous, capable of reasoning over unstructured data, and adaptive
- Developers need new skills: Prompt Engineering for CRM, Guardrails & Security, Tool Creation (Apex actions, Flow templates)
- Flow Builder and Apex remain foundational tools that AI agents use to interact with data
- Einstein Copilot Studio for orchestrating AI tools

### 2026 Developer Trends: Salesforce & Full Stack
**URL**: https://www.dekodecamp.com/blogs/2026-developer-trends-salesforce-fullstack
**Published**: February 4, 2026

Key trends shaping developer careers in 2026:

- **The Hybrid Developer**: Companies want developers who combine Salesforce platform skills with full-stack code (Next.js/React + Salesforce back-end)
- **Top 3 high-salary skills**: LWC (Lightning Web Components), Salesforce API Integration, DevOps for Salesforce
- Developers with dual Salesforce + JavaScript proficiency earn ~25% more than single-specialty peers
- Salesforce handles auth, database, security out of the box; full-stack skills enable unique UX

### Mastering LWC for Enterprise Development
**URL**: https://www.dekodecamp.com/blogs/mastering-lwc-enterprise-dev
**Published**: January 28, 2026

Guide to Lightning Web Components (LWC) as the key skill for Salesforce Developers:

- LWC is Salesforce's modern UI framework using ES6+ and Web Components standards
- Performance: native browser execution, far faster than legacy Aura components
- Reusability: build once, use in App Builder and Digital Experiences (Communities)
- Learning path for Admins: (1) Modern JavaScript ES6+, (2) DOM fundamentals, (3) Salesforce Data Service/wire service
- LWC skills are the bridge between standard web development and the Salesforce ecosystem
